intro: Polytrias amaura var. pallida, commonly known as the pale polytrias, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with a delicate, feathery appearance. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits to pollinators.
